docs.abstract: Creative's new speaker dock makes the iPod or iPhone the remote control.

headline.main: Music From Your iPhone Straight to the Speakers, Wirelessly

docs.lead_paragraph: Creative Technology has a pretty good track record when it comes to funneling music wirelessly through my house. Auditioning the company's Sound Blaster Wireless for iTunes device about a year ago, I found it to be a nearly bulletproof way to send music from iTunes on my Mac to my stereo system in another room sans cables.

docs.abstract: New Jersey Atty Gen Anne Milgram announces settlement of lawsuit against Stevens Institute of Technology and its embattled president Harold J Raveche; under agreement, Raveche will step down and institute will accept extensive governance changes that will stiffen oversight of its financial management; Milgram accused Raveche of plundering school's endowment and receiving $1.8 million in illegal low-interest loans (M)

headline.main: New Jersey Has Settled With a College It Sued

docs.lead_paragraph: The embattled president of Stevens Institute of Technology, Harold J. Raveché, will step down in July, the college said Friday. And under the terms of a settlement ending a lawsuit by the State of New Jersey that questioned his $1.1 million salary, the institute said it had accepted extensive governance changes that would stiffen oversight of its financial management. Dr. Raveché will be paid his salary, which exceeds those earned by the presidents of Harvard, Princeton and M.I.T., for a year after he leaves office July 1, Attorney General Anne Milgram said. And under the terms of his contract, Dr. Raveché will be compensated as a consultant through June 2014, she said.

docs.abstract: Creative Labs Sound Blaster World of Warcraft headset is designed to take advantage of sounds in multiplayer role-playing online game; wireless version costs $160 and wired model $120; photo (S)

headline.main: To Better Hear the Approaching Troll, or the Satisfying Blast

docs.lead_paragraph: When it comes to engaging in virtual combat, the sonics make all the difference: the crackle of video game gunfire, the resonating boom of bazookas, the drip-drip-drip of water in a silent room as you stalk the enemy. Game developers expend extraordinary effort to create realistic sound in their adventures. Two new pairs of slick headphones are dedicated to recreating the gamer's audio universe. For both, there are options to add some rather outre graphics as well.

docs.abstract: Gadgetwise column highlights Seagate's new GoFlex Home Network storage system; photo (S)

headline.main: Home Storage System Offers Automatic Remote Access

docs.lead_paragraph: Seagate has pulled off a remarkable feat: The company has integrated remote access to files stored on its new GoFlex Home Network Storage System so thoroughly and intelligently that it requires no setup. In fact, when testing the GoFlex Home network-attached storage (N.A.S.) drive, I called Seagate for technical support because I couldn't figure out how to set up remote access. I was never prompted to set up a dynamic DNS account, as other NAS drives do, and figured something was amiss.
